p: A further Chinese patient living with HIV had 34 CD4 cells/Î¼L and a prolonged course of COVID-19 ( 12). An additional HIV-infected patient with fever, muscle aches and right lower lobe pneumonia at a chest CT scan was reported by Chinese authors from Shenzhen ( 13). However, SARS-CoV-2 RNA was persistently negative on different specimen samples at various times during the course of his illness ( 13), and we cannot therefore be sure that this patient was SARS-CoV-2-coinfected.
